title: Chinese official claims tennis star's case 'maliciously hyped up'

title: #MeToo, feminist organizations silent on Chinese tennis star’s disappearance after assault allegations
description: Feminist organizations in the U.S. have remained silent on the disappearance and ongoing concern over Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai

title: Peng Shuai: Olympic committee says it spoke with Chinese tennis star in 30-minute video call
description: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) said Sunday that organization leadership held a 30-minute call with Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai.

title: New Chinese-media Peng Shuai video 'insufficient,' WTA maintains threat to pull tournament
description: Chinese state-backed media continues to spread new "proof" that missing tennis champ Peng Shuai is safe and healthy, but officials say these seemingly staged videos and pictures are not good enough.

title: Novak Djokovic on Australian Open plans after COVID vax mandate: 'We’ll just have to wait and see'
description: Novak Djokovic’s status for the Australian Open next year is up in the air as the tennis major became the first Grand Slam event to require players to be vaccinated against COVID-19.

title: Peng Shuai: Videos purporting to show missing Chinese tennis star raise questions
description: Chinese media touted two new videos as evidence that missing tennis star Peng Shuai is safe and healthy, but the videos have only raised further questions about the player’s wellbeing.

title: UN, White House demand proof of Peng Shuai's safety, China says it's ‘not aware’ of issue
description: The U.N. and White House have joined the growing demand for assurances and proof that missing Chinese tennis champ Peng Shuai is safe.

title: Peng Shuai: Tennis stars, politicians call for boycott as Chinese champ remains missing
description: Tennis pros and politicians are demanding action against China as doubts continue to grow over the safety and well-being of missing world-class doubles champion Peng Shuai. Stars Naomi Osaka, Serena Williams, and Chris Evert are among those speaking out. The hashtag #whereispengshuai trended on Twitter this week.

title: Muguruza wins WTA Finals for first time, beating Kontaveit
description: Garbiñe Muguruza's trip to Mexico started last week with a taste of tequila. After winning the WTA Finals on Wednesday, it ended the same way.

title: Barty finishes year as WTA's No. 1 for 3rd consecutive time
description: Wimbledon champion Ash Barty finished No. 1 in the WTA singles rankings for the third consecutive season, while Katerina Siniakova topped the doubles rankings for the second time.

title: Doubts over China tennis star's email raise safety concerns
description: A Chinese professional tennis player not seen in public since she accused a former top government official of sexual assault purportedly sent an email claiming she was safe and that the allegation was false, a message that only amplified concerns about her safety and demands for information about her well-being and whereabouts.

title: Chinese officials silent on missing tennis star after sexual assault claim, Xi crackdown may be connected
description: Chinese officials have remained silent or outright dodged questions about missing tennis player Peng Shuai after posting an email she allegedly sent to the Women's Tennis Association (WTA).

title: WTA chairman casts doubt on email from missing Chinese tennis star: 'only raises my concerns'
description: Women’s Tennis Association Chairman and CEO Steve Simon said Wednesday that he had a hard time believing an email supposedly written by missing Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai and released by Chinese state media was legitimate.

title: Federer sees 'end is near,' hopes for on-court bye
description: Just before the start of Wimbledon in late June, Roger Federer recalled a conversation about retirement that he had with Pete Sampras a decade ago.

title: Chinese tennis pro Peng's disappearance may be part of Xi's cultural crackdown
description: The mystery surrounding the disappearance of Chinese tennis star Peng Shuai shows another example of a country intent on cracking down on anyone who poses a threat to the authority of cultural purity of the country.

title: Novak Djokovic beats Rublev to reach ATP Finals semifinals
description: Novak Djokovic advanced to the semifinals of the ATP Finals by beating Andrey Rublev 6-3, 6-2 on Wednesday.

title: Shocked tennis star Osaka posts: Where is Peng Shuai?
description: Tennis star Naomi Osaka says she's been shocked to hear about a fellow player who has gone quiet since making a sexual assault allegation against a former top government official in China.

title: Djokovic beats Ruud at ATP Finals for 6th straight victory
description: Novak Djokovic extended his winning streak to six matches with a 7-6 (4), 6-2 victory over Casper Ruud on Monday at the ATP Finals.

title: Chinese tennis champ's allegation against vice premier prompts calls for probe from WTA, ATP
description: The alleged incident between Chinese tennis player Peng Shuai and a powerful politician resulted in calls from Women’s Tennis Association (WTA) CEO Steve Simon and Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP) chairman Andrea Gaudenzi for an investigation into the matter.

title: Rafael Nadal calls those refusing the COVID vaccine 'selfish'
description: The Australian Open may require tennis players to be vaccinated against the coronavirus in 2022, and that appears to be quite all right with superstar Rafael Nadal.

title: Muguruza beats Kontaveit to reach semifinals at WTA Finals
description: Garbiñe Muguruza ended Anett Kontaveit´s 12-match winning streak with a 6-4, 6-4 victory Sunday that propelled her into the semifinals at the WTA Finals.

title: Medvedev beats Hurkacz in opening match of ATP Finals
description: Strong serving and consistent baseline play propelled U.S. Open champion Daniil Medvedev to a 6-7 (5), 6-3, 6-4 win over first-time qualifier Hubert Hurkacz in the opening match of the ATP Finals on Sunday.

title: Tennis champ ‘vanishes’ after sexual assault claim against Chinese politician: report
description: A Chinese tennis player has reportedly vanished a week after accusing China’s former vice-premier of sexual abuse, according to reports.

title: Kontaveit, Muguruza post wins at WTA Finals in Mexico
description: Anett Kontaveit stretched her winning streak to 12 matches by beating Karolina Pliskova 6-4, 6-0 on Friday to secure a spot in the semifinals at the WTA Finals.

title: Djokovic reaches Paris final to end record 7th year as No. 1
description: Novak Djokovic will end the year at No. 1 for a record seventh time after rallying to beat Hubert Hurkacz 3-6, 6-0, 7-6 (5) in the Paris Masters semifinals on Saturday.

title: Tennis, sex and politics combine in Chinese #MeToo scandal
description: Chinese authorities have squelched virtually all online discussion of sexual assault accusations apparently made by a Chinese professional tennis star against a former top government official, showing how sensitive the ruling Communist Party is to such charges.

title: Australian Open for unvaccinated athletes in question as lawmakers remain at odds
description: The status of unvaccinated players at the Australian Open in January has taken another turn this week as local state officials in Victoria, where the Grand Slam will be held, are at odds with government officials over exemptions.

title: Australian Open to allow unvaccinated players, despite officials' pushback: report
description: Unvaccinated tennis players could end up participating in the Australian Open at the beginning of next year, according to a leaked email from Australia Tennis.

title: Novak Djokovic must be fully vaccinated to play in Australian Open, official says
description: Novak Djokovic’s impressive record at the Australian Open could be in danger after the state officials announced Wednesday that any tennis player wanting to compete in the Grand Slam must be fully vaccinated.

title: Prospect of no jab, no visa for Australian Open tennis stars
description: Tennis players who haven’t received a COVID-19 vaccination are unlikely to get a visa to enter the country for the Australian Open in Melbourne in January, according to the political leader of the state which hosts the season-opening major.

title: Novak Djokovic won't reveal vaccine status as Australian officials say unvaccinated unlikely to get visas
description: Novak Djokovic declined to reveal his vaccination status in an interview on Monday as Australian officials say they believe unvaccinated players will not likely be granted visas to compete at the Australian Open in January.

title: Basilashvili, Norrie reach Indian Wells final without Top 25
description: Nikoloz Basilashvili beat American Taylor Fritz 7-6 (5), 6-3 on Saturday to set up a final against Cameron Norrie at the BNP Paribas Open, which will crown its first men’s winner ranked outside the Top 25 since 2010.

title: Upsets send Fritz, Basilashvili to semis at Indian Wells
description: Taylor Fritz beat No. 3 seed Alexander Zverev 4-6, 6-3, 7-6 (3) on Friday to reach the semifinals of the BNP Paribas Open in front of a hometown crowd, scoring the biggest win of his young career.

title: Dimitrov downs top-seeded Medvedev in 3 sets at Indian Wells
description: Grigor Dimitrov outlasted top-seeded Daniil Medvedev 4-6, 6-4, 6-3 Wednesday in the fourth round of the BNP Paribas Open, extending the parade of upsets that has knocked out several top players.

title: US Open champ Raducanu upset at Indian Wells; Murray wins
description: Emma Raducanu came down to earth in her first tournament since her surprising U.S. Open victory, losing in straight sets to Aliaksandra Sasnovich at the BNP Paribas Open on Friday night.

title: Naomi Osaka falls out women's tennis top 10
description: Former No. 1 female tennis star Naomi Osaka is dropping like a stone in the WTA rankings, falling from 7th to 12th this morning. Today’s ranking marks the first time that Osaka has dropped out of the top 10 in the last three years, dating back to August 2018.

title: Roger Federer calls for change amid mental health focus, blames social media: 'It’s a horrible situation'
description: Roger Federer empathizes with young athletes growing up in the age of social media and thinks change needs to happen to better help athletes deal with the pressures of the big stage.

title: Hurkacz wins Moselle Open for 3rd title in 2021
description: Top-seeded Hubert Hurkacz clinched his third title of the year and fourth win in four finals as he beat Pablo Carreno Busta 7-6 (2), 6-3 in the Moselle Open final on Sunday,

title: Naomi Osaka withdraws from next month's Indian Wells tourney
description: Naomi Osaka pulled out of the BNP Paribas Open on Wednesday, a move that was expected after she indicated following her U.S. Open loss this month that she planned to take another extended break from tennis.

title: Raducanu back in Britain and in demand after US Open win
description: She’s been on American talk shows, attended the Met Gala, ticked off a “bucket list” item by visiting the New York Stock Exchange, and chatted to Formula One champion Lewis Hamilton — a major deal for a big motorsports fan.

title: Raducanu's US Open title moves her up 127 spots to No. 23
description: Emma Raducanu's qualifier-to-champion run at the U.S. Open vaulted her 127 spots in the WTA rankings to a career-high No. 23 on Monday.

title: Daniil Medvedev reveals the key to beating Novak Djokovic, winning US Open
description: Daniil Medvedev pulled off a shocking upset of Novak Djokovic at the U.S. Open on Sunday and won the first major title of his career.

title: Daniil Medvedev explains US Open celebration: 'Only legends will understand'
description: Daniil Medvedev collapsed onto the court at the U.S. Open on Sunday after defeating Novak Djokovic in straight sets to win his first career major title.

title: Serbia cries with Djokovic over lost chance to make history
description: Serbia awoke to disappointment on Monday after Novak Djokovic failed in his attempt to make tennis history by becoming the first man in more than 50 years to win a calendar-year Grand Slam.

title: Daniil Medvedev stuns Novak Djokovic to pick up US Open title
description: Daniil Medvedev upset Novak Djokovic in the U.S. Open men’s final on Sunday and won the first major of his career.

title: Leylah Fernandez shares uplifting message for New Yorkers after us open loss on 9/11
description: “I hope I can be as strong and as resilient as New York has been the past 20 years,” announced Leylah Fernandez, whose own resilient spirit spearheaded an extraordinary run at the US Open.

title: Emma Raducanu wins US Open, defeating Leylah Fernandez to end improbable tournament
description: Emma Raducanu defeated Leylah Fernandez in straight sets to win the U.S. Open women’s final.

title: Leylah Fernandez meets Emma Raducanu in US Open final: What to know
description: Leylah Fernandez and Emma Raducanu will battle in the U.S. Open final on Saturday.

title: Djokovic, Medvedev win US Open men's semis, head to Sunday's final
description: If Novak Djokovic does complete the first calendar-year Grand Slam for a man since 1969 — and he is headed to the U.S. Open final, just one victory away — he, and everyone else, will remember one particularly pivotal, and epic, game along the way.

title: Rising star Leylah Fernandez: 'Teacher told me to stop playing tennis, you'll never make it'
description: Leylah Fernandez’s run to the U.S. Open final has been exciting, but she revealed her tennis career was nearly derailed by a teacher who didn’t offer support.

title: Raducanu, 18, Fernandez, 19, into US Open final
description: Emma Raducanu and Leylah Fernandez are so similar in so many ways: They possess enviable quickness and anticipation.

title: Djokovic tops Berrettini in Open QF to close in on true Slam
description: Never fazed, rarely flummoxed, Novak Djokovic is so collected in best-of-five-set matches even when falling behind, as he has done repeatedly at the U.S. Open.

title: Emma Raducanu makes history as she advances to US Open semifinals

description: With no players from the United States left to pull for in the U.S. Open, the fans are adopting a neighbor from the North to treat as one of their own: Leylah Fernandez, an unseeded Canadian teenager with an exciting game and enthusiasm to match.

title: For 1st time, no US singles players in US Open quarterfinals
description: On the day that the U.S. Open quarterfinals began without any Americans left in singles — the first time that's ever happened at an event first held in 1881 — the man in charge of finding and grooming the country's Grand Slam champions sought to look on the bright side.

title: Medvedev stops van de Zandschulp, gets back to US Open semis
description: Daniil Medvedev reached the U.S. Open semifinals on Tuesday for the third straight year, ending the surprising run of qualifier Botic van de Zandschulp with a 6-3, 6-0, 4-6, 7-5 victory.

title: Naomi Osaka still haunted by Serena Williams debacle, ex-USTA chair says
description: Katrina Adams, the former USTA chair and president, spent the first 28 pages of her new leadership book/memoir, “Own the Arena” detailing the Naomi Osaka-Serena Williams debacle during the 2018 U.S. Open Finals.

title: Djokovic extends Slam bid; 1st time no US players in Open QF
description: For 1 1/2 sets, including one particularly compelling and competitive 24-point game, Novak Djokovic's fourth-round opponent at the U.S. Open — Jenson Brooksby, the last American left in singles — gave him fits amid a raucous atmosphere at Arthur Ashe Stadium.

title: Garbine Muguruza slams ‘unprofessional’ Barbora Krejcikova in testy US Open exchange
description: Garbine Muguruza was not going to leave the court at Arthur Ashe Stadium on Sunday without calling opponent Barbora Krejcikova “so unprofessional” to her face.

title: Fernandez, 18, beats Kerber at US Open to follow Osaka upset
description: Raising her right fist overhead to celebrate winner after winner, 18-year-old Leylah Fernandez demonstrated that her upset of defending champion Naomi Osaka at the U.S. Open was certainly no fluke by beating another past title winner at Flushing Meadows.

title: Prepping to play Djokovic without day-before practice, plan

title: Unqualified Success: van de Zandschulp stuns again at Open
description: The fact that Botic van de Zandschulp was playing in Louis Armstrong Stadium for the first time for his 4-hour, 20-minute, will-he-or-won’t-he-blow-it victory was an incredible enough achievement for the Dutch qualifier.

title: Djokovic lets emotions show at US Open; No. 1 Barty loses
description: Novak Djokovic did not seek to keep his thoughts to himself on court Saturday, the way he mostly did through his first two U.S. Open matches. Instead, he let it all out, slapping his chest or sneering with a fist raised to celebrate success, pointing to his ear to ask the crowd for noise.

title: Alcaraz, 18, upends No. 3 Tsitsipas at US Open; Osaka out
description: Until now, 18-year-old Carlos Alcaraz has exhibited enough promise and precociousness to make people think he eventually could succeed Rafael Nadal as Spain’s top tennis player.

title: Naomi Osaka ousted at US Open, weighs another break from tennis

title: Stefanos Tsitsipas' long bathroom breaks at US Open prompt ATP, USTA to review game delay rules
description: The ATP and UTSA announced Thursday that they plan to review the rules surrounding match delays in response to Greek tennis player Stefanos Tsitsipas, who has come under fire this week for unusually long bathroom breaks at the U.S. Open.

title: Djokovic eyeing calendar-year Slam at Open
description: Novak Djokovic missed an overhead and stared over toward a section of the Arthur Ashe Stadium stands.

title: British teen Raducanu making another Slam run at US Open
description: Emma Raducanu quickly seems to have figured out this Grand Slam thing. The 18-year-old who was born in Canada and represents Britain is into the third round at the U.S. Open after getting to Week 2 of Wimbledon in her major debut at age 18.

title: No. 1 Barty, top US Open women win easily after Ida delays
description: About the only problems No. 1 seed Ash Barty and other top players encountered Thursday afternoon at the U.S. Open came in the delays trying to get to Flushing Meadows in the aftermath of Hurricane Ida's remnants blowing through the Northeast a night earlier.

title: Stefanos Tsitsipas takes another long bathroom break at US Open, players call for rule change
description: Stefanos Tsitsipas has come under fire again after taking another unusually long bathroom break during his second-round match at the U.S. Open on Wednesday, prompting other players to call for a rule change.

title: Ida remnants cause 'crazy weather' at US Open

title: Stephens overpowers Gauff at US Open; Osaka's foe withdraws
description: Three years ago, a reporter asked Sloane Stephens to point out a younger tennis player most fans might not have heard of yet, someone she thought could become a household name someday.

title: Novak Djokovic confuses chants for opponent as boos at US Open: 'You always wish to have the crowd behind you'
description: Novak Djokovic was playing against more than just Danish qualifier Holger Vitus Nodskov Rune to advance past the first round of the U.S. Open on Tuesday night.

title: Wimbledon champ urges tennis players to get COVID vaccination

title: Djokovic tops teen 'Ruuune!' at US Open in calendar Slam bid
description: If the last-name chorus of “Ruuuuuune!” in support of his relatively unknown teenage opponent at the U.S. Open bothered Novak Djokovic, he never let anyone know.

title: 'Cressy!' chants break out as American pulls US Open stunner
description: Maxime Cressy had heard people chanting his name in college, when he twice clinched big wins against his rival school.

title: "Cressy!" chants break out as American pulls US Open stunner
description: Maxime Cressy had heard people chanting his name in college, when he twice clinched big wins against his rival school.

title: Olympic champ Zverev wins at US Open; Djokovic set to begin
description: Olympic gold medalist Alexander Zverev ran his winning streak to 12 matches by beating Sam Querrey 6-4, 7-5, 6-2 on Tuesday in the first round of the U.S. Open.

title: Nick Kyrgios throws tantrum at US Open over towels: 'It's just absurd for me'
description: Nick Kyrgios caused controversy Monday during his straight-set loss to Roberto Bautista Agut at the U.S. Open.

title: Osaka wins US Open return, hopes to 'believe more in myself'
description: Here's the realization Naomi Osaka came to, gradually and only recently: If other people think a lot of her, she probably should, too.

title: 2012 champ Murray tumbles out of US Open against Tsitsipas
description: Andy Murray tumbled to the ground on his artificial hip, losing his balance in sweat-soaked shoes and leaving splotches on Arthur Ashe Stadium’s blue court from his soggy clothing.

title: Stephens, Keys have practice plans wrecked by US Open match
description: Sloane Stephens and Madison Keys are close friends who last week were supposed to be practice partners.

title: Even as COVID cases rise, US Open, other events welcome fans
description: Full-throated shouts and hearty applause returned to the U.S. Open tennis tournament Monday, bursts of sound that offered some form of reaction to nearly each and every action. Also back: lengthy lines to get through the gates and to buy something to eat or drink.

title: Naomi Osaka acknowledges she needs to change her mindset ahead of US Open

title: Laver would welcome Djokovic to calendar Grand Slam 'club'
description: If Novak Djokovic wins the U.S. Open two weeks from now to complete the first calendar-year Grand Slam in men’s tennis since 1969, “Rocket” Rod Laver will be there to welcome him into a remarkably exclusive group.

title: Djokovic's true Slam bid at US Open starts against qualifier
description: Novak Djokovic will begin his bid to win the U.S. Open for a men's-record 21st major tennis championship and to complete a calendar-year Grand Slam by facing a player who comes through qualifying.

title: US Open to provide 'quiet rooms' for struggling tennis players
description: The U.S. Open will have some new additions as the U.S. Tennis Association (USTA) puts more of a focus on players’ mental health.

title: 2020 Australian champ Sofia Kenin out of US Open with COVID
description: Fifth-ranked Sofia Kenin pulled out of the U.S. Open on Wednesday because she recently tested positive for COVID-19, even though she said she has received a vaccine.

title: No masks, vax proof to see matches at full-capacity US Open
description: Spectators will not be required to wear masks or show proof of their vaccination status to attend matches at the U.S. Open when the tennis tournament returns at full capacity next week, one year after all fans were banned from the event because of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Serena Williams pulls out of US Open over devastating injury

title: US Open champs get lowest payout since 2012; total prizes up
description: The two singles champions at this year’s U.S. Open will earn 35% less than in 2019, the last time the Grand Slam tennis tournament allowed spectators, while prize money for qualifying and the first three rounds of the main draw will rise as part of an overall increase.

title: Barty, Zverev notch efficient wins in Cincinnati finals
description: Ash Barty bounced back from a disappointing loss at the Tokyo Olympics. Gold medalist Alexander Zverev carried over his momentum from Tokyo.

title: No. 1 Barty beats Krejcikova to reach semis in Cincinnati
description: Top-ranked Ash Barty beat Barbora Krejcikova 6-2, 6-4 on Friday to reach the semifinals of the Western & Southern Open.

title: Rafael Nadal ends 2021 season over injury: 'I am confident I will recover again'
description: Rafael Nadal will forgo the U.S. Open and the rest of the tournaments on the schedule the season because of a chronic foot injury.

title: Medvedev advances to W&S quarterfinals; Osaka knocked out
description: No Novak, no Roger, no Rafa doesn’t mean winning his second Western & Southern Open championship will be easy for top-seeded Daniil Medvedev.

title: Naomi Osaka reflects on emotional press conference, losing sight of the real 'accomplishment'
description: Fresh off a win at the Western & Southern Open on Wednesday, Naomi Osaka addressed her emotional press conference earlier this week that began with a question about her relationship with the media.

title: Naomi Osaka tested by Gauff, wins 3-setter in tour return
description: Two days after a thoughtful exchange with a local sports columnist, Naomi Osaka delivered a more relevant statement on the court.

title: 2-time champ Venus Williams receives wild card into US Open
description: Two-time champion Venus Williams will be back at the U.S. Open after being given a wild card Wednesday into the Grand Slam tournament.

title: Naomi Osaka breaks down in tears, briefly exits press conference after question about media relationship

title: 2012 champ Andy Murray in US Open draw; Wawrinka withdraws
description: Andy Murray moved into the field for the U.S. Open on Monday when another past champion at Flushing Meadows, Stan Wawrinka, pulled out because he still is recovering from foot surgery.

title: Nadal bounced by 50th-ranked Harris in Washington

title: With painful foot, Nadal tops Sock at Washington in return
description: There were moments, to be sure, when Rafael Nadal played quite like someone competing for the first time in nearly two months and dealing with a left foot injury he acknowledged afterward was painful.

title: Ex-Olympic boss reportedly wanted Hideki Matsui to light flame, not Naomi Osaka
description: Before resigning in disgrace, the president of the Japanese Olympic Committee pushed to have former Yankees player Hideki Matsui light the flame in Tokyo rather than tennis star Naomi Osaka because he wanted someone who was “pure Japanese,” according to a report.

title: Umpire holds back Jordan Thompson in wild tennis scene: 'Call the police'
description: A blown call by a chair umpire sparked a heated verbal altercation between two tennis players in a first-round match at the Citi Open in Washington D.C. on Tuesday.

title: Rafael Nadal jabs Novak Djokovic after Olympian's tantrum in bronze-medal match
description: Rafael Nadal took a slight jab at Novak Djokovic over the Serbian tennis star’s outburst at the Olympics during his bronze-medal match against Spain’s Pablo Carreno Busta.

title: Zverev follows up win over Djokovic with Olympic gold
description: Alexander Zverev followed up his comeback win over Novak Djokovic by winning the gold medal in men’s tennis at the Tokyo Olympics.

title: Novak Djokovic leaves Olympics empty-handed after bronze medal match meltdown
description: Novak Djokovic came to Tokyo in pursuit of a Golden Slam but after Saturday’s bronze medal match against Spain’s Pablo Carreño Busta, he’ll be leaving empty-handed.
