description: With so much on the line — the Golden Slam, the calendar-year Grand Slam, Olympic singles gold — it’s been a mystery to many why Novak Djokovic entered the mixed doubles tournament at the Tokyo Olympics.

title: Italy's Fabio Fognini shouts homophobic slur in Olympics loss, apologizes
description: Italian tennis player Fabio Fognini was heard shouting homophobic slurs at himself during his Olympics match against Russian Olympic Committee player Daniil Medvedev on Wednesday.

title: Daniil Medvedev overcomes extreme temps to reach quarters as Olympic organizers change schedule to avoid heat
description: Russian Daniil Medvedev advanced to the quarterfinal round of the Olymipcs' men’s singles tennis tournament on Wednesday, but his biggest competition is the blazing heat.

title: Naomi Osaka: High pressure of Olympics 'a bit much'
description: Naomi Osaka was upset in the third round of the Tokyo Olympics, losing to Marketa Vondrousova, of the Czech Republic, in straight sets on Tuesday.

title: Olympics tennis favorite Ash Barty upset in first round to Spain's Sara Sorribes Tormo
description: Australia’s Ash Barty, world No. 1, was upset in the first round of the Tokyo Olympics women’s tennis tournament on Sunday, losing to Spain’s Sara Sorribes Tormo in the sweltering heat.

title: Naomi Osaka 'happy again' after Olympics victory
description: Tennis star Naomi Osaka appeared at the 2021 Olympic Games in Tokyo and won her first match since taking a leave of absence from the sport to focus on her mental health.

title: Naomi Osaka wins debut Olympic tennis match after skipping French Open, Wimbledon
description: Japanese tennis player Naomi Osaka told reporters she felt a "little bit out of my body" after winning her Olympic debut match in Tokyo on Sunday – her first victory in more than two months.

title: Swiatek, daughter of an Olympian, wins Tokyo tennis opener
description: Having grown up listening to stories from her father about competing at the 1988 Olympics in rowing, then having won a bronze medal herself in doubles at the Summer Youth Olympics, Iga Swiatek had been thinking about competing at the Tokyo Games for some time.

title: Naomi Osaka lights Olympic cauldron to end Tokyo ceremony
description: Tennis star Naomi Osaka on Friday lit the Olympic torch cauldron signifying the start of the Tokyo Games. She is representing Japan in the Games.

title: Djokovic knows 'history is on the line' at Tokyo Olympics
description: Novak Djokovic knows how close he is.

title: Osaka makes her return against Zheng at Tokyo Olympics
description: Naomi Osaka’s first match in nearly two months will come against 52nd-ranked Zheng Saisai of China in the opening round of the Olympic tennis tournament.

title: Coco Gauff no-go for Olympics after testing positive for coronavirus
description: Coco Gauff shared disappointing news on Sunday, revealing she will have to miss the upcoming Tokyo Olympics after testing positive for COVID-19.

title: Novak Djokovic posts he is in for Tokyo Olympics
description: Novak Djokovic is going to the Tokyo Olympics, keeping alive his chance for a “Golden Slam.”

title: Wimbledon matches under investigation for 'possible irregular betting patterns': reports
description: Officials have launched an investigation this week into at least two Wimbledon matches after bookmakers detected “possible” suspicious betting patterns, reports say.

title: Britain's Johanna Konta to miss Olympics due to COVID-19
description: Johanna Konta of Britain won't compete at the Tokyo Olympics after testing positive for COVID-19, she said Tuesday, after being dropped from Wimbledon just over two weeks ago when a member of her team contracted the virus.

title: Roger Federer says he's out of Olympics after knee 'setback'
description: Roger Federer will not participate in the Tokyo Olympics, writing on social media Tuesday that he “experienced a setback" with his knee during the grass-court season.

title: Novak Djokovic picks up historic Wimbledon victory over Matteo Berrettini
description: Novak Djokovic defeated Matteo Berrettini to win the sixth Wimbledon championship of his career, tying him with Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal for most grand slam victories of all-time with 20.

title: Kate Middleton steps out for first time after COVID-19 isolation at Wimbledon with Prince William
description: Kate Middleton made a splash at Wimbledon Saturday – attending the women’s final alongside Prince William and presenting the victor, Australia’s Ashleigh Barty, with the trophy.

title: Tom Cruise hits Wimbledon with rumored girlfriend and 'Mission: Impossible 7' co-star Hayley Atwell
description: Hollywood superstar Tom Cruise was spotted attending the women’s finals at Wimbledon Saturday alongside English actress and rumored girlfriend Hayley Atwell as well as another co-star from expected upcoming blockbuster.

title: Pliskova proud of effort to make Wimbledon final competitive
description: It's never a good thing to lose the first 14 points of a Grand Slam final. At least Karolina Pliskova could laugh and smile about it afterward.

title: Ash Barty tops Karolina Pliskova at Wimbledon for 2nd Grand Slam title
description: Ashleigh Barty of Australia held off Karolina Pliskova 6-3, 6-7 (4), 6-3 during the Wimbledon final on Saturday for the second Grand Slam title of her career.

title: Wimbledon final: Djokovic eyes 20th Slam, Berrettini his 1st
description: The man standing between Novak Djokovic and a record-tying 20th Grand Slam title, Matteo Berrettini, remembers being wowed by Wimbledon when he played in the junior event as a teenager.

title: Italy's Berrettini reaches 1st Grand Slam final at Wimbledon
description: Cries of “Vai!” (Go!), “Forza!” (Let's go!) and even “Andiamo, amore mio!” (Let's go, my love!) rang through Centre Court, supporting Matteo Berrettini in his native tongue on his way to becoming Italy's first Grand Slam finalist in 45 years.

title: Meghan Markle quietly reached out to Naomi Osaka amid mental health break from tennis
description: In an essay in Time magazine’s Olympic preview issue, Naomi Osaka wrote that she hopes “we can enact measures to protect athletes, especially the fragile ones."

title: Tennis star Nick Kyrgios drops out of Olympics over fan ban, injuries
description: Tennis star Nick Kyrgios dropped out of the Olympics on Thursday after Tokyo 2020 organizers announced there would be no fans at the Games due to coronavirus concerns.

title: No. 1 Barty to face Pliskova in 1st Wimbledon final for both
description: It might have been difficult for Ash Barty to imagine that a trip to her first Wimbledon final was just around the corner when she stopped playing at last month's French Open with a hip injury.

title: Naomi Osaka: Kneeling to protest racism, wearing mask in pandemic 'so obvious'
description: Some hotly debated issues in the world are "so obvious" to tennis star Naomi Osaka.

title: Naomi Osaka suggests 'better' press conference format, giving pro athletes 'mental break' from scrutiny
description: Tennis star Naomi Osaka suggested in an essay published Thursday that pro athletes should be able to take a mental break from press conferences and media scrutiny.

title: Boris Becker's catching heat for calling tennis player's fiancée 'pretty' during Wimbledon broadcast
description: Imagine living in a world where a tennis legend gets in trouble during a Wimbledon broadcast for calling a tennis player’s fiancée “very pretty.” WE’RE LIVING IN THAT WORLD! Boris Becker, working BBC’s Wimbledon coverage, caused an uproar for commenting on Márton Fucsovics’s future wife Anett Böszörményi.

title: 8-time Wimbledon champ Roger Federer unsure if he'll be back
description: Roger Federer has been feted by plenty of ovations at Wimbledon's Centre Court. None quite like this one, though. This was not a celebration and didn't come at the end of the match.

title: 8-time Wimbledon champ Federer loses quarterfinal to Hurkacz
description: Roger Federer has been feted by plenty of ovations at Centre Court. None quite like this one, though. This was not a celebration. It felt more like a “Thank you” or — just in case — a “Goodbye.”

title: Hurkacz faces idol Federer in 1st Grand Slam quarterfinal
description: Hubert Hurkacz was 6 years old when Roger Federer won his first Wimbledon title.

title: 2018 champion Kerber vs. No. 1 Barty in Wimbledon semifinals
description: When Angelique Kerber grabbed the opening set of her Wimbledon quarterfinal Tuesday, the full-capacity crowd saluted the accomplishment with cheers that bounced off the closed roof at No. 1 Court.

title: On last Manic Monday, Federer, Djokovic, Kerber stick around
description: It was Wimbledon’s last Manic Monday — as of next year, no longer will all 16 fourth-round singles matches be scheduled on one day, a tradition vanishing along with that of a Middle Sunday without any play — and yet, amid all the chaos of simultaneous matches, one could be forgiven for imagining Roger Federer held the stage to himself.

title: Djokovic wins at Wimbledon for 50th major quarterfinal berth
description: Two-time defending champion Novak Djokovic held every service game Monday and reached his 50th Grand Slam quarterfinal by beating No. 17-seeded Cristian Garín at Wimbledon, 6-2, 6-4, 6-2.

title: Naomi Osaka's return to action highlights Olympic tennis
description: As it was, Naomi Osaka would have been one of the most-watched, most-discussed, most-supported athletes at the Tokyo Olympics.

title: After last Middle Sunday, Wimbledon resumes with fresh faces
description: Wimbledon's traditional Middle Sunday of rest will disappear in 2022, as will the Manic Monday that follows it.

title: Full Wimbledon crowds allowed from quarterfinals to finals
description: Crowds at Wimbledon's Centre Court and No. 1 Court can increase to 100% capacity for the singles quarterfinals through the end of the tournament.

title: Britain's Raducanu, 18, joins Gauff, 17, in Wimbledon Week 2
description: Here’s how hushed the crowd at No. 1 Court was before points Saturday: You could hear Emma Raducanu’s palm slap her thigh while she waited to receive serves.

title: Roger Federer finds his rhythm, reaches Week 2 at Wimbledon
description: Roger Federer knows, naturally, that this Wimbledon marks his last Grand Slam tournament before turning 40. He knows, too, that he hadn't played a third-round match at a major in nearly 1 1/2 years. And, truthfully, he knows he can't possibly know how many more he has left.

title: Djokovic wins again at Wimbledon: 'Somehow I found a way'
description: Any lapse by Novak Djokovic is brief.

title: Ashleigh Barty advances to third round at Wimbledon
description: Top-ranked Ash Barty advanced to the third round of a Wimbledon women’s draw depleted of other top contenders by beating Anna Blinkova 6-4, 6-3 Thursday.

title: Coco Gauff, 17, Jennifer Brady lead US Olympic tennis team
description: Coco Gauff and Jennifer Brady will lead a U.S. Olympic tennis team that will go to the Tokyo Games without any of the country's two highest-ranked women or four top men, according to a roster obtained Wednesday by The Associated Press.

title: Kyrgios 'not bad for a part-time player' in Wimbledon win
description: Nick Kyrgios was back on the scene at Wimbledon, offering his inimitable brand of showmanship and shot-making, with tennis by turns exhilarating and exasperating.

title: Wimbledon officials defend court conditions amid injury chaos
description: The opening two days at Wimbledon have been marred with harsh criticism of the conditions of the famous grass courts which has seen 23-time Grand Slam champion Serena Williams forced to withdraw after sustaining an injury but event organizers are standing by the state of the courts.

title: Tennis legend Boris Becker blasts Naomi Osaka for skipping Wimbledon
description: Tennis legend Boris Becker had some tough words for Naomi Osaka at the start of Wimbledon last week after she annnounced she would skip the tournament.

title: Benoit Paire penalized, heckled during Wimbledon match
description: Benoit Paire was the source of some controversy on Tuesday during his straight-set loss to Diego Schwartzman in his first-round Wimbledon match.

title: Serena Williams 'heartbroken' over withdrawing from Wimbledon match
description: Serena Williams admitted Tuesday she was “heartbroken” she had to withdraw from her Wimbledon match.

title: Serena Williams out at Wimbledon after sustaining leg injury
description: During Tuesday’s first-round match against Aliaksandra Sasnovich, Serena Williams suffered a leg injury and was forced to stop playing.

title: Venus, 41, rises to 90th Wimbledon win in 90th career major
description: Venus Williams accumulated 10 aces Tuesday by smacking serves at up to 114 mph — not quite like the old days, but not too shabby, either.

title: Andy Murray gets 1st Wimbledon win since 2017, reveals cringey detail of brief break
description: Andy Murray, a two-time Wimbledon champion who is still trying to get back to peak form after two hip surgeries, pulled off a big win over No. 24 Nikoloz Basilashvili.

title: Barty commits to Australia's tennis team for Tokyo Olympics
description: Top-ranked Ash Barty is set to lead Australia’s 11-member tennis team at the Tokyo Olympics.

title: At Wimbledon, Murray 'can still play at the highest level'
description: The Centre Court crowd roared when Andy Murray walked out onto the green grass for his first Wimbledon match in four years. He smiled and replied with a thumbs-up.

title: American-born Frances Tiafoe stuns Stefanos Tsitsipas on Day 1 at Wimbledon
description: If Monday is a sign of what is to come at Wimbledon, the tournament will feature a ton of upsets.

title: Serena Williams says she will not play at the Tokyo Olympics
description: Serena Williams said she will not go to the Tokyo Olympics, but did not want to say why during her pre-Wimbledon video conference with reporters Sunday.

title: Federer unsure about Olympics; will reassess after Wimbledon
description: Roger Federer is still not sure whether he will compete at the Tokyo Olympics, saying Saturday that he and his team plan to “reassess the situation after Wimbledon.”

title: 2019 champion Simona Halep out of Wimbledon with calf injury
description: Reigning Wimbledon champion Simona Halep withdrew from the Grand Slam tournament Friday because of an injured left calf.

title: Andy Murray picked for British team to defend Olympic gold
description: Two-time defending champion Andy Murray will attempt to win his third consecutive Olympic gold medal after being named to the British team on Thursday.

title: Naomi Osaka steps away from 'personal time' to tweet about mag cover
description: Naomi Osaka on Monday ended her social media silence to reveal she was on the cover for Vogue Magazine Japan.

title: Berrettini emulates Becker with Queen’s title at 1st attempt
description: Big-serving Matteo Berrettini dropped a set for the first time at the Queen's Club tournament before going on to beat Britain's Cameron Norrie 6-4, 6-7 (5), 6-3 in Sunday's final.

title: Samsonova completes remarkable week by winning German Open
description: Qualifier Liudmila Samsonova completed a remarkable week by beating Belinda Bencic 1-6, 6-1, 6-3 to win the German Open on Sunday.

title: Naomi Osaka withdraws from Wimbledon to take 'personal time,' will compete at Olympics
description: Four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka withdrew from Wimbledon on Thursday just hours after organizers said they had been in talks with the tennis star over the tournament's media operations, reports said.

title: Rafael Nadal skipping Wimbledon, Olympics; hopes rest will help prolong career
description: Tennis great Rafael Nadal announced Thursday he will skip Wimbledon and the Olympics to focus on recovering after playing in the French Open, Italian Open and Madrid Open in a span of a few weeks.

title: US Open tennis tournament to allow 100% fan capacity in 2021
description: The U.S. Open tennis tournament will allow 100% spectator capacity throughout its entire two weeks in 2021, a year after spectators were banned from the event because of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Federer fails to make Halle Open quarterfinals for 1st time
description: Roger Federer failed to reach the Halle Open quarterfinals for the first time Wednesday when Félix Auger-Aliassime rallied from a set down to stun the former champion 4-6, 6-3, 6-2 in the second round.

title: Give Novak Djokovic his due as he paves his ‘own path’
description: The question put to Novak Djokovic after he won the French Open for his 19th Grand Slam title, moving within one of rivals Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal for the men's record, was whether he ever was resigned to not being able to catch them.

title: Tsitsipas says his grandmother died just before French final
description: French Open runner-up Stefanos Tsitsipas said Monday his grandmother died just before he played the final at Roland Garros against Novak Djokovic.

title: French Open champ Krejcikova 15th in singles, 1st in doubles
description: French Open champion Barbora Krejcikova's twin titles at Roland Garros earned jumps in the WTA rankings to No. 15 in singles and No. 1 in doubles.

title: French tennis officials defend handling of Naomi Osaka situation: 'We did it the right way'
description: Naomi Osaka’s decision to skip press conferences at the French Open and later withdraw from the tournament altogether raised awareness about athletes’ mental health and drew the ire of tennis organizers.

title: Djokovic gives racket to supportive young fan
description: Novak Djokovic says he’s grateful to a young boy who offered vocal support and advice throughout the French Open final.

title: French Open runner-up Tsitsipas says he learned a lesson
description: When Stefanos Tsitsipas' first Grand Slam final had ended, he sank into his changeover chair and buried his head in a towel.

title: Novak Djokovic comes from behind to win 2nd French Open title
description: After dropping the first two sets of the French Open final, Novak Djokovic rallied to a 6-7 (6), 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-4 victory over Stefanos Tsitsipas on Sunday for his 19th Grand Slam title.

title: French Open defends 'pragmatic' stance in Osaka dealings
description: French Open organizers defended their “pragmatic” approach in their dealings with four-time major champion Naomi Osaka during the tournament, saying Sunday they tried to engage with her several times before she decided to withdraw because she needed a mental health break.

title: Krejcikova completes titles sweep in Paris with Siniakova
description: French Open champion Barbora Krejcikova completed a rare sweep of titles at Roland Garros as she won a third women's doubles major trophy with fellow Czech teammate Katerina Siniakova on Sunday.

title: Barbora Krejcikova wins first Grand slam title at French Open after defeating Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova
description: Unseeded Czech tennis player Barbora Krejcikova won her first Grand Slam title after defeating Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova in three sets in the Women’s French Open Final on Saturday.

title: Tsitsipas tops Zverev in 5 at French Open for 1st Slam final
description: Stefanos Tsitsipas went from way ahead to suddenly stuck in a five-set struggle against Alexander Zverev at the French Open on Friday before emerging to earn his first berth in a Grand Slam final.

title: Unseeded Krejcikova, Pavlyuchenkova reach French Open final
description: The ball landing at Barbora Krejcikova's feet on match point appeared to come down behind the baseline.

title: Russian Pavlyuchenkova advances to 1st major final in Paris
description: Tour veteran Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova endured long stretches where she didn’t enjoy tennis, and because her consistency and confidence were so elusive she considered calling it a career.

title: Djokovic-Nadal, Tsitsipas-Zverev in French Open semifinals
description: Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal know there's something special about the two of them meeting in the French Open semifinals — even if they'd prefer, of course, for it to happen a round later.

title: French Open fans unhappy as COVID curfew imposed at 11 p.m.
description: Novak Djokovic’s French Open quarterfinal against Matteo Berrettini was delayed for about 22 minutes Wednesday evening while thousands of spectators were cleared out because of an 11 p.m. coronavirus curfew.

title: Rafael Nadal to face Novak Djokovic in French Open semifinal
description: Two points from a straight-set victory, Novak Djokovic seemingly was well on his way to a French Open semifinal showdown against Rafael Nadal when so much went awry Wednesday night.

title: No. 1 Djokovic reaches 40th Grand Slam semifinal
description: Top-ranked Novak Djokovic has reached his 40th Grand Slam semifinal after beating ninth-seeded Matteo Berrettini 6-3, 6-2, 6-7 (5), 7-5.

title: Nadal drops set, beats Schwartzman to reach French Open SF
description: Rafael Nadal's French Open set streak is over. His pursuit of a record-breaking 21st Grand Slam title — including 14 at Roland Garros — remains very much intact.

title: Sakkari tops 2020 French champ Swiatek; 4 in 1st Slam SFs
description: When one last forehand from defending champion Iga Swiatek landed wide in the French Open quarterfinals, Maria Sakkari crouched on Court Philippe Chatrier and bowed her head, relishing the moment.

title: Tsitsipas beats Medvedev, will face Zverev in French Open SF
description: Stefanos Tsitsipas and Alexander Zverev both have been viewed as potential future stars of tennis. Both have come close to Grand Slam titles.

title: French Open Lookahead: Gauff, 17, seeks first Slam semifinal
description: LOOKAHEAD TO WEDNESDAY

title: After going 0-6 in Slam QFs, Pavlyuchenkova finally wins 1
description: Don't get Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova wrong: Of course she's happy to finally make it to her first Grand Slam semifinal at age 29 after going 0-6 in major singles quarterfinals — and 0-5 in doubles quarterfinals — until now.

title: Zverev reaches 3rd Grand Slam semifinal, 1st at French Open
description: Alexander Zverev did not want to believe that his opponent in the French Open quarterfinals had saved a break point with a shot that landed on — or was it merely near? — a line in the fourth game Tuesday.

title: Zidansek, Pavlyuchenkova reach semifinals at French Open
description: Before the French Open, Tamara Zidansek had never advanced past the second round at any Grand Slam.

title: Djokovic, Nadal beat Italian teens to reach French Open QFs
description: For two sets and more than two hours at the French Open on Monday, Novak Djokovic found himself being outplayed by a 19-year-old opponent from Italy making his Grand Slam debut.

title: Medvedev-Tsitsipas showdown highlights French Open schedule
description: Medvedev-Tsitsipas showdown highlights French Open schedule

title: Djokovic recovers from 2-set French Open hole against teen
description: Novak Djokovic went from a big deficit to his best tennis at the French Open on Monday, erasing a two-set hole and grabbing 13 games in a row in a dominant display before his opponent stopped playing because of a back problem.

title: Bright future: Gauff reaches French Open quarterfinals at 17
description: A day after Serena Williams was eliminated from the French Open, 17-year-old Coco Gauff showed the future in tennis for American women is bright.

title: Nadal, Djokovic face Italian teenagers Monday at French Open
description: A quick look at the French Open.

title: Serena Williams loses at French Open; Federer withdraws
description: Serena Williams turns 40 in September. Roger Federer hits that milestone the month before. No one knows how many more French Open appearances each will make, and this year's tournament ended for both on Sunday.

title: Pavlyuchenkova's back in French Open quarters, 10 years on
description: Ten years later, Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova is back in the quarterfinals of the French Open after beating 2013 semifinalist Victoria Azarenka 5-7, 6-3, 6-2 on Sunday.

title: Roger Federer chooses rest, withdraws from French Open
description: Roger Federer withdrew from the French Open on Sunday to give himself a chance to recover after emerging from a tight third-round victory that lasted about 3 1/2 hours.

title: Federer needs 4 tight sets to reach French Open's 4th round
description: Roger Federer was honest with himself, and everyone else, before the French Open, saying he knew he didn’t have any chance of winning the title. He arrived in Paris, after all, having played just three matches over the preceding year-plus following two knee operations.

title: Early departure: Aryna Sabalenka upset at French Open
description: The early departure of seeded players in the women's tournament continued at the French Open as third-seeded Aryna Sabalenka was upset by Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova on Friday in the third round of the clay-court Grand Slam.

title: French Open champion Nadal reaches 3rd round on empty court
description: Amid an unusual silence on an empty center court at the French Open, defending champion Rafael Nadal celebrated his 35th birthday with something very familiar: another victory against Richard Gasquet.

title: 'Beats all of us losing': 4 US men, 8 women still in French
description: When the French Open’s third round gets underway Friday, there will be four men from the United States on the schedule — the largest contingent from the country to get that far in Paris in 25 years.

title: Slowing down? Federer says no as he advances at French Open
description: Roger Federer disliked the implication he's slowing down.

title: Top-ranked Ash Barty retires from French Open with injury
description: Top-ranked Ash Barty was forced to retire from her second-round match at the French Open on Thursday because of an injury.

title: Practice makes perfect: Serena's serve leads to win in Paris
description: Her superior serve back at its unreturnable best, Serena Williams was in full control of her French Open match — until, suddenly, that stroke wasn’t as dominant and neither was she.

title: Nishikori grinds out another 5-set win at French Open
description: Two matches. Ten sets. A total of 628 points played.

title: Venus Williams gives blunt answer on how she deals with reporters: 'You’ll never light a candle to me'
description: Venus Williams gave a blunt answer Tuesday when she was asked for perspective on how she deals with the media amid Naomi Osaka dropping out of the French Open over mental health concerns.

title: Bubba Watson says anxiety struggles of Naomi Osaka 'hits a little close to home'
description: Professional golfer Bubba Watson on Tuesday spoke out about the decision by four-time Grand Slam champion Naomi Osaka to withdraw from the French Open this week, citing struggles with anxiety and depression.

title: Spanish player, 32, plays again at French Open after cancer
description: Carla Suárez Navarro was pleased, of course, to be back on a tennis court at the French Open on Tuesday night after being treated for cancer, competing for the first time in nearly 1 1/2 years.

title: Petra Kvitova withdraws from French Open after sustaining ankle injury during 'post-match press requirements'
description: Two-time Grand Slam champion Petra Kvitova announced her withdrawal from the French Open on Tuesday after she says she hurt her ankle while fulfilling her post-match press requirements over the weekend.

title: Tennis leaders promise to offer Naomi Osaka 'support and assistance' about mental health concerns
description: A day after tennis star Naomi Osaka withdrew from the French Open, the leaders of the four Grand Slam tournaments responded with a statement on Tuesday promising to address her concerns about mental health.

title: Column: Even more questions for Osaka when she returns
description: Unfortunately for Naomi Osaka, the questions will keep coming. There’s nowhere to run and certainly no place to hide when you’re a superstar traveling the world and playing on the biggest stages in tennis.

title: 'Choked': Nadal's opponent flubs set points at French Open
description: Winning a match against Rafael Nadal at the French Open is downright difficult, of course: He went into Tuesday with a 100-2 career record at the place.

title: Top-ranked Barty advances at French Open, Rublev eliminated
description: At the mercy of Bernarda Pera's deep groundstrokes and struggling with her moves, top-ranked Ashleigh Barty gave the impression that her return to Roland Garros would be short-lived.

title: Boris Becker on Naomi Osaka's French Open withdrawal: 'I almost feel like her career is in danger'
description: Tennis legend Boris Becker warned Tuesday that Naomi Osaka’s "career is in danger" after her decision to withdraw from the French Open to deal with her mental health.

title: French tennis boss takes heat for avoiding press questions after Naomi Osaka criticism
description: French Tennis Federation president Gilles Moretton faced more scrutiny Monday when he avoided taking questions from the press after making a statement on Naomi Osaka’s withdrawal from the French Open.

title: Naomi Osaka's sister gave insight to tennis star's mental health before decision to withdraw from French Open
description: Naomi Osaka’s sister opened up about the tennis star’s decision to avoid the media at the French Open on Sunday before the decision to opt out of the tournament was made.

title: Tennis officials in Naomi Osaka saga 'needed to be more compassionate,' ex star says
description: Pam Shriver, a former tennis star, blasted tennis organizers on Monday for their handling of Naomi Osaka’s boycott of press conferences and threatening her with harsh penalties.

title: Serena Williams talks media scrutiny amid Naomi Osaka's withdrawal from French Open: 'It made me stronger'
description: After her first-round victory on Monday at the French Open, Serena Williams discussed anxiety when dealing with the media and said that she experienced it often after matches.

title: Tennis great 'so sad' over Naomi Osaka's withdrawal from French Open
description: After tennis star Naomi Osaka announced on Monday that she would withdraw from the French Open amid scrutiny over her decision to boycott talking to the media, many current and former athletes shared their thoughts on Osaka’s decision.

title: French Open lookahead: Nadal, Djokovic start their bids
description: A quick look at the French Open

title: King vs queen: Defending French champs practice together
description: For an audience with the “King of Clay,” the current queen of clay thought it best to come prepared.

title: Patrick McEnroe, Billie Jean King weigh in on Naomi Osaka's decision to withdraw from French Open
description: Tennis legends Patrick McEnroe and Billie Jean King shared their thoughts on Naomi Osaka’s decision to withdraw from the French Open on Monday afternoon amid media boycott backlash.

title: Serena Williams wins in 1st night session at French Open
description: Serena Williams is a winner in the first scheduled night session in French Open history. She overcome two set points to beat Irina-Camelia Begu 7-6 (6), 6-2 under the lights in the first round.

title: French Open's statement following Naomi Osaka quitting amid media boycott backlash
description: Tennis star Naomi Osaka wrote a lengthy Twitter post on Monday saying that she withdrew from the French Open after facing backlash over her decision to boycott talking to the media.

title: Le grand retour: Federer wins return to Paris, Slam action
description: They feted Roger Federer with as loud as applause gets from a crowd capped at 1,000 people in Court Philippe Chatrier — when he walked out with a wave, when he hit one of his 48 winners, even when he attempted a back-to-the-net 'tweener and hit the ball out.

title: Naomi Osaka withdraws from French Open amid scrutiny over media boycott
description: Naomi Osaka withdrew from the French Open on Monday amid scrutiny over her decision to boycott talking to the media.

title: Defending French Open champ Iga Swiatek: 'Good relationship with media' can help
description: Defending French Open champion Iga Swiatek expressed a more positive view about her relationship with the media on Sunday amid the controversy over Naomi Osaka’s boycott of press conferences at the event.

title: Naomi Osaka responds after $15K fine for skipping French Open press conference
description: Tennis star Naomi Osaka fired back Sunday after she was fined $15,000 for skipping a mandatory press conference following her first-round victory at the French Open.

title: More fans, May weather: 2021 French Open is closer to normal
description: Still not quite its packed, pre-pandemic self, Roland Garros bubbled with tennis, cheers and sun-kissed pleasures again Sunday as this year's tournament began with some color back in its cheeks compared to the bland edition held in the autumnal chill last year.

title: Thiem loses to Andujar in 5 sets at French Open
description: Reigning U.S. Open champion and two-time French Open finalist Dominic Thiem squandered a two-set lead and is out of Roland Garros.

title: Naomi Osaka fined $15G for not participating in press conference following first-round win at French Open
description: Naomi Osaka stuck to her word about not attending the post-match news conference at the French Open on Sunday, but now she is paying for not honoring media obligations.

title: After win, Osaka skips news conference in Paris, as promised
description: Naomi Osaka skipped her post-match news conference at the French Open on Sunday, as promised.

title: Naomi Osaka's French Open press boycott not meshing with fellow tennis stars
description: Naomi Osaka’s decision to boycott press events during the French Open didn’t exactly jive with her fellow tennis superstars, including No. 1-ranked Ashleigh Barty.

title: Djokovic, Nadal, Federer grouped in same half at French Open
description: Well, here's a new one for the Big Three of men's tennis: Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal and Roger Federer ended up in the same half of the French Open field.

title: Naomi Osaka says she won't speak to media at French Open
description: Tennis phenom Naomi Osaka announced in a Twitter post on Wednesday that she won’t participate in any press conferences during the upcoming French Open.

title: Brooksby, 20, heads to Paris, 2 years after a US Open splash
description: Like many a 20-year-old American in Paris for the first time, tennis pro Jenson Brooksby is excited about where he is and eager to see where he's headed.

title: Djokovic can't hit US Open line judge -- there won't be any
description: Novak Djokovic does not need to worry about accidentally hitting a U.S. Open line judge with a tennis ball between points this year because there won't be any line judges — chair umpires will be the only on-court officials at that Grand Slam tournament’s matches.

title: Roger Federer laughs after hitting Gael Monfils with low blow in video
description: Roger Federer’s pinpoint accuracy can use some work, and friend Gael Monfils paid the price.

title: Serena Williams unlikely to get historic win at French Open, coach says
description: Serena Williams’ return to tennis after some time off has been off to a disappointing start, and for those thinking she might still earn her record-tying 24th Grand Slam at the French Open later this month, long-time coach Patrick Mouratoglou says don’t count on it.

title: Roger Federer predicts loss at French Open: 'I know I will not win'
description: Roger Federer’s loss on Tuesday came with a harsh reality check for the 20-time Grand Slam champion who now says he’s confident that he "will not win" the French Open set to begin in late May.

title: Roger Federer gets ‘super uncomfortable’ over Alexander Zverev domestic abuse questions
description: Roger Federer has weighed in on allegations of domestic abuse leveled at tennis star Alexander Zverev, saying the ATP should not get involved in players’ private lives.

title: Roger Federer loses in comeback at Geneva Open
description: Roger Federer played his first match on clay in nearly two years. However, it wasn’t the comeback that the legendary tennis player had hoped for.

title: Serena Williams loses in straight sets to Siniakova in Parma
description: Serena Williams’ disappointing return to tennis continued when she lost in straight sets to 68th-ranked Katerina Siniakova in the second round of the Emilia-Romagna Open on Tuesday.

title: Nadal beats a tired Djokovic for 10th Italian Open title
description: Rafael Nadal beat a tired Novak Djokovic 7-5, 1-6, 6-3 for a record-extending 10th Italian Open title on Sunday.

title: Them again: Djokovic and Nadal to meet in Italian Open final
description: Maybe the new generation of tennis players isn’t quite so ready to end the eras of Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal.

title: Novak Djokovic lashes out at Italian Open chair umpire during match
description: Novak Djokovic had an explosive outburst during the qualifying round Tuesday at the Italian Open, where he lashed out at a chair umpire for allowing the match to continue as rain poured down on the clay court.

title: No US men in Top 30 for 1st time in computer tennis rankings
description: There are no American men in the ATP's Top 30 for the first time in the nearly half-century of computerized tennis rankings.

title: Serena Williams returning after 'very intense' training
description: Forget all that speculation about Serena Williams considering retirement after her emotional hand-to-heart gesture upon her Australian Open exit three months ago.

title: Naomi Osaka conflicted over holding the Tokyo Olympics
description: Naomi Osaka is conflicted over whether the Tokyo Olympics should be held amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Nadal, nearing 35, says retirement not on his mind at all
description: Less than a month from his 35th birthday, Rafael Nadal is not thinking about retirement at all.

title: Nadal to face promising Spanish teenager at Madrid Open
description: It wasn't too long ago that Rafael Nadal was handing Carlos Alcaraz a PlayStation as the boy's prize at a local tennis tournament in Spain.

title: Basilashvili beats Struff in Munich Open final for 5th title
description: Nikoloz Basilashvili clinched his second title of the year with a 6-4, 7-6 (5) victory over Jan-Lennard Struff in the final of the Munich Open on Sunday.

title: Wimbledon Middle Sunday play in '22; fans, money TBD in '21
description: For all of the pandemic-related planning discussed for this year's return of Wimbledon — much still to be determined, including fan capacity and prize money — Tuesday's biggest news out of the All England Club takes effect in 2022: There will be play on the Grand Slam tournament's middle Sunday.

title: Novak Djokovic responds to Rafal Nadal’s remark that he is 'obsessed' with records: 'What I feel is passion'
description: Novak Djokovic and Rafal Nadal’s rivalry was reignited his week when the Spanish tennis pro seemed to take aim at his opponent for being “obsessed” with racking up Grand Slams, prompting Djokovic to fire back and defend himself.

title: Federer to play the French Open, preparing for it at Geneva
description: Roger Federer announced Sunday he will play at the French Open, and the Swiss star is preparing for it on home clay at a tournament in Geneva next month.

title: Tsitsipas wins Monte Carlo Masters without dropping a set
description: Stefanos Tsitsipas won the Monte Carlo Masters without dropping a set, beating Andrey Rublev 6-3, 6-3 on Sunday for his first title this year and sixth overall.

title: Top-ranked Djokovic loses, No. 3 Nadal eases into quarters
description: Top-ranked Novak Djokovic lost 6-4, 7-5 to Dan Evans on Thursday in the third round of the Monte Carlo Masters for his first defeat of the year.

title: French Open postponed by a week because of pandemic
description: The French Open tennis tournament will be delayed by one week because of the coronavirus pandemic, organizers said Thursday.

title: No. 1 Barty repeats as Miami champ when Andreescu retires
description: No. 1-ranked Ash Barty won her second successive Miami Open championship Saturday by beating No. 8-seeded Bianca Andreescu, who was injured when she fell and retired trailing in the second set.

title: Italian 19-year-old Jannik Sinner reaches Miami Open final
description: Former junior skiing champion Jannik Sinner has joined some fast company at the Miami Open.

title: Defending champ Barty to play Andreescu in Miami Open final
description: In her first match at this year's Miami Open, Ash Barty was one point from elimination. Now she’s one win from becoming a repeat champion.

title: Osaka's 23-match win streak ends against Sakkari in Miami
description: No. 2 Naomi Osaka's 23-match winning streak ended Wednesday when she lost to Maria Sakkari of Greece in the quarterfinals of the Miami Open, 6-0, 6-4.

title: Barty, Medvedev rise to challenge on tough day at Miami Open
description: Aryna Sabalenka clearly labored in the final set of her match. Frances Tiafoe seemed to barely have the energy needed to reach the post-match handshake.

title: Bautista Agut survives to oust Isner in 3 sets at Miami Open
description: Roberto Bautista Agut didn’t take the easiest route to the Miami Open quarterfinals.

title: Top-ranked tennis players not keen on getting coronavirus vaccine: 'So far I don't really trust it'
description: Some of the Women's Tennis Association's top players expressed concerns about getting the vaccine Monday at the Miami Open.

title: Barty goes distance, tops Azarenka to reach Miami quarters
description: Ash Barty is tough to beat under any circumstances, especially when she’s on the ropes.

title: Hobbled Daniil Medvedev limps to 3rd-round win at Miami Open
description: Daniil Medvedev could barely walk, much less run. He could still serve, though.

title: Naomi Osaka condemns hate crimes against Asian Americans in scathing tweet
description: Tennis star Naomi Osaka condemned recent hate crimes against Asian Americans in a Saturday tweet.

title: Jack Draper collapses during Miami Open, forced to retire from match
description: British tennis player Jack Draper was forced to bow out of his Miami Open match on Thursday after he collapsed on the court in the heat while playing his first set against Mikhail Kukushkin.

title: Top-ranked Barty overcomes match point for win at Miami Open
description: Because of canceled flights, it took Ash Barty 45 hours to travel from her native Australia to Florida for a tennis tournament.

title: Canadian tennis player Vasek Pospisil apologizes for profanity-laced tirade blasting ATP chairman
description: Canadian tennis pro Vasek Pospisil apologized on Twitter Wednesday after he attacked ATP Chairman Andrea Gaudenzi in a profanity-laced tirade during his first-round exit from the Miami Open.

title: Serena Williams remark by sports radio host leads to his dismissal
description: A Buffalo, N.Y., sports radio host was fired Wednesday for making a comment about Serena Williams and other Black celebrities when talking about women he found attractive.

title: Serbian model says she was offered $70G to seduce, film Novak Djokovic as a part of smear plot: report
description: A Serbian Instagram model claims she was approached with an offer of $70,000 to seduce 18-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic and film the two together in an attempt to diminish his character and attack his marriage, according to reports.

title: Gasparyan retires in final, Kasatkina wins in St. Petersburg
description: Daria Kasatkina won the St. Petersburg Ladies Trophy on Sunday when wild card Margarita Gasparyan retired from their all-Russian final with a lower back injury.

title: Tennis pro Tim Puetz suffers freak eye injury during Qatar Open
description: German tennis player Tim Puetz suffered a freak eye injury on Wednesday during a doubles match at the Qatar Open.

title: No fans? Some? A mix? Odd sights, sounds of pandemic sports
description: Sports amid the pandemic became a whole different sort of spectacle, especially when it came to spectators — often with zero, sometimes with some and, in at least one instance at a Grand Slam tennis tournament, starting a match with fans in the seats yet finishing it with none present.

title: Djokovic breaks Federer's record for most weeks as ATP No. 1
description: Novak Djokovic surpassed Roger Federer for the most weeks at No. 1 in the ATP rankings on Monday.

title: Serena Williams backs Meghan Markle, jabs media after Oprah Winfrey interview
description: Serena Williams expressed her support for Meghan Markle as the Duchess of Sussex and her husband, Prince Harry, revealed a multitude of turmoil in the royal family.

title: Tauson beats Golubic to win Lyon Open and a 1st career title
description: Danish teenager Clara Tauson clinched her first career title in style, beating Viktorija Golubic 6-4, 6-1 on Sunday to win the Lyon Open without dropping a set after coming through two qualifying rounds.

title: 'I was down': Federer had hard time before 2nd knee surgery
description: Roger Federer never seriously contemplated retirement while he was away from the tennis tour for more than a year. He did have a hard time dealing with the need for a repeat operation on his bad right knee, though.

title: Everyman's everyman, who faced Federer at Wimbledon, retires
description: Marcus Willis, the Everyman’s everyman who was ranked 772nd when he faced Roger Federer at Wimbledon in 2016, is ending his playing career and will focus on coaching tennis to help kids learn “that anyone can live the dream.”

title: Federer out of Miami Open; will train to 'work his way back'
description: Roger Federer is withdrawing from this month's Miami Open so he can spend extra time preparing to “work his way back out on tour,” his agent told The Associated Press on Monday.

title: Djokovic ties Federer in weeks at No. 1; Gauff up to No. 38
description: Novak Djokovic is gaining on Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal in the Grand Slam standings, and he’s already caught Federer in another significant statistic: As of Monday, Djokovic has been No. 1 in the ATP rankings for a total of 310 weeks.

title: Citing bad back, Rafael Nadal out of Rotterdam tournament
description: Rafael Nadal pulled out of next week's hard-court tournament at Rotterdam, Netherlands, because of the bad back that bothered him during the Australian Open.

title: Osaka back to No. 2; Medvedev No. 3; Karatsev jumps 72 spots
description: Naomi Osaka's Australian Open championship moved her up one spot to No. 2 in the WTA rankings Monday, while men's finalist Daniil Medvedev rose to a career-best No. 3 behind winner Novak Djokovic on the ATP list.

title: Australian Open fans slammed for booing mention of coronavirus vaccine rollout
description: Fans at the Australia Open were criticized on Sunday after they appeared to boo the mention of a coronavirus vaccine rollout during the men's final trophy presentation.

title: Djokovic tops Medvedev in Australian Open final for 18th Grand Slam title
description: Novak Djokovic has beaten Daniil Medvedev 7-5, 6-2, 6-2 to win his ninth Australian Open championship and 18th Grand Slam title.

title: Osaka tops Brady at Australian Open for 4th Grand Slam title
description: Naomi Osaka grabbed six consecutive games to beat Jennifer Brady 6-4, 6-3 on Saturday.

title: At Australian Open, Djokovic chases 18th Slam, Medvedev 1st
description: Novak Djokovic lost his first career Grand Slam final at the U.S. Open. Then he won his second, which came at the Australian Open.

title: Medvedev's streak at 20; faces Djokovic in Australian final
description: Daniil Medvedev simply does not lose right now. Not to Top 10 opponents. Not to anyone, really. Certainly not to a drained Stefanos Tsitsipas in the Australian Open semifinals

title: Naomi Osaka edges out Serena Williams at Australian Open
description: Naomi Osaka has beaten Serena Williams in the Australian Open semifinals, halting Williams’ effort for a record-tying 24th Grand Slam singles title.

title: Jennifer Brady into 1st Grand Slam final at Australian Open
description: After the unusual path Jennifer Brady followed — college tennis at UCLA; just one tour-level title so far; more recently, a two-week hard quarantine upon arrival in Australia — perhaps it was fitting she took a circuitous route to her first Grand Slam final.

title: Tsitsipas edges Nadal in Australian Open quarterfinal
description: For the 225th time in his illustrious career, Rafael Nadal grabbed a two-set lead in a Grand Slam match. For only the second time, he blew that big edge and lost.

title: 'Not normal': Djokovic raises quarantine-injury connection
description: Novak Djokovic won an Australian Open match between two guys with abdominal muscle issues, setting up a semifinal against someone who beat an opponent with debilitating back spasms.

title: Serena tops Halep at Australian Open, sets up Osaka showdown
description: Serena Williams was not pleased with the way her play suddenly was slipping in the Australian Open quarterfinals.

title: At Australian Open, players can reveal, or hide, injuries
description: Novak Djokovic came clean, or so it seemed, right after his third-round victory at the Australian Open, about pain in his midsection after an awkward, torso-twisting slip.

title: Daughter of Bills, Sabres owners into all-US QF in Australia
description: After Jessica Pegula earned her first trip to a Grand Slam quarterfinal, the daughter of the owners of Buffalo's NFL and NHL franchises scribbled on the screen of an Australian Open courtside TV camera: “Hi Mom, Hi Dad. See u next rnd Jen B.”

title: Injured Djokovic advances to quarters at Australian Open
description: Novak Djokovic wore tape above his right hip, and winced when he stretched for some shots in a three-hour match against Milos Raonic that will go into the records as his 300th win at a major.

title: Down but not out, Serena Williams into Australian Open QFs
description: Serena Williams tumbled to the ground, her heavily taped right ankle turning, her body contorting, her racket flying.

title: Hey, Australian Open TV viewers: Those claps aren't real
description: Hey, Australian Open TV viewers: The crowd's loud clapping and mid-match chatter you hear on the telecasts are not real.

title: Australian Open goes quiet as lockdown keeps crowds away
description: Inside an empty Rod Laver Arena, the fluttering of a photographer's camera suddenly seemed all too distracting before a player served.

title: Medvedev in 5, finally, advances to 4th round in Australia
description: Daniil Medvedev finally worked out how to a win a five-setter. All by himself.

title: Australian Open: No-look shot in Serena's win; COVID fan ban
description: If Serena Williams somehow manages to conjure up another on-the-run, back-to-the-net, no-look, over-the-shoulder shot in her next Australian Open match, a local coronavirus flareup means there won't be any spectators to react with the appreciative applause and yells that greeted this one.

title: Australian Open heckler flips off Rafael Nadal, gets escorted out as tennis star laughs in bewilderment
description: Rafael Nadal defeated American Michael Mmoh in straight sets on Thursday to advance to the third round of the Australian Open but not before his match was disrupted by an unruly heckler who was eventually escorted out by event security.

title: Feeling pressure: 2020 champ Kenin loses at Australian Open
description: Sofia Kenin knew this would be a tough test at the Australian Open, a potentially early end to her first attempt to defend a Grand Slam title.

title: Djokovic holds off Tiafoe, reaches 3rd round in Australia
description: Frances Tiafoe had never played a No. 1, had never beaten anyone in the Top 5, and now he'd just won a tiebreaker against Novak Djokovic to level their second-round match at the Australian Open.

title: Venus finishes Australian Open loss on injured ankle, knee
description: This was, in some ways, rather difficult to watch: 40-year-old Venus Williams gasped and groaned as she limped around the court at the Australian Open on an injured right ankle and left knee.

title: Nadal, Barty advance in straight sets at Australia Open
description: Facing a break point late in the third set, Rafael Nadal sprinted to his left and hit a running forehand winner from way out wide.

title: Denis Shapovalov rages over bathroom break denial during Australian Open match: 'What do you mean I can't go?'
description: Denis Shapovalov was forced to hold it in during his Australian Open first-round match against Jannik Sinner on Tuesday.

title: Tennis star Gael Monfils breaks down after upset loss at Australian Open
description: Tennis star Gael Monfils broke down Monday after losing in five sets to Finland’s Emil Ruusuvuori in the first round of the Australian Open.

title: No holding back; Nadal through in straight sets in Australia
description: Facing a break point late in the third set, Rafael Nadal sprinted to his left and hit a running, around-the-post forehand that landed just inside the line.

title: Serena Williams has one-word reaction to Tom Brady's 7th Super Bowl victory
description: Serena Williams on Monday offered her take on Tom Brady winning his seventh Super Bowl ring and fully cementing his championship legacy in the NFL.

title: Djokovic: 'Makes my heart full' to see Aussie Open crowd
description: It's been so long since he had a sizeable crowd to play for, the showman in Novak Djokovic just had to come out.

title: As Serena, Nadal eye records at Australian Open, COVID looms
description: The draw for the Australian Open was pushed back a day, too.

title: Williams withdraws from semifinals in Australian Open tuneup
description: Serena Williams withdrew from an Australian Open tuneup tournament citing a right shoulder injury on Friday within hours of setting up a semifinal match against top-ranked Ash Barty.

title: Tony Trabert, 5-time major singles champion, dies at 90
description: Tony Trabert, a five-time Grand Slam singles champion and former No. 1 player who went on to successful careers as a Davis Cup captain, broadcaster and executive, has died. He was 90.

title: Testing times: Organizers say Aussie Open will start on time
description: There were 160 players back in isolation because a hotel quarantine worker tested positive for COVID-19.

title: So many events in Melbourne, until COVID disrupted the plan
description: Erima Nishimura sure picked a decent day to bring her 9-year-old son, Yoshiharu, to Melbourne Park for the first time to see some tennis.

title: COVID case at Australian Open hotel cancels play at tuneups
description: All competition at six Australian Open tuneup events scheduled for Thursday was called off after a worker at one of the tournaments’ Melbourne quarantine hotels tested positive for COVID-19.

title: Nadal sidelined; team Djokovic wins to open ATP Cup defense
description: Rafael Nadal didn't make it for Spain's ATP Cup opener because of a sore back, deciding it wasn't worth the risk a week ahead of the Australian Open.

title: Serena Williams through easily in 1st Australian Open tuneup
description: Serena Williams restarted her lengthy quest for a 24th Grand Slam singles title with a 6-1, 6-4 win over Daria Gavrilova in an Australian Open tuneup tournament at Melbourne Park on Monday.

title: Serena Williams, Nadal, Halep win at Adelaide exhibition
description: Serena Williams was preparing to play Naomi Osaka at an Adelaide exhibition tournament on Friday. But first things first — after 14 days in quarantine because of the COVID-19 pandemic regulations in Australia, the 23-time Grand Slam singles champion took her daughter to the zoo.

title: Serena visits zoo before win; Djokovic on court in Australia
description: Serena Williams was preparing to play Naomi Osaka at an Adelaide exhibition tournament on Friday. But first things first — after 14 days in quarantine because of the COVID-19 pandemic regulations in Australia, the 23-time Grand Slam singles champion took her daughter to the zoo.

title: Serena Williams admits some of her 23 Grand Slam trophies might have been 'taken'
description: Serena Williams is on her way to tying the record for the most Grand Slam titles by either a man or woman, with her appearance at the Australia Open next month -- but the tennis pro seems to have literally lost track of a few of her trophies.

title: Tennis legend Margaret Court to receive top Australian honor; faces massive backlash over anti-LGBT views
description: Margaret Court, a tennis legend who won each of the sport’s four major tournaments multiple times and has created controversy over her anti-LGBT views, is set to be honored on Australia Day.

title: Spanish tennis player says she tested positive for COVID-19
description: A Spanish tennis player ranked in the top 70 who was forced to quarantine in her hotel room after potentially being exposed to the coronavirus on an Australian Open charter flight says she tested positive for COVID-19.

title: 3 more COVID-19 cases linked to Australian Open arrivals
description: Two players are among the three latest COVID-19 cases that have emerged from testing conducted on passengers who arrived on charter flights bringing people to Melbourne for the Australian Open.

title: Novak Djokovic has list of demands pertaining to COVID-19 protocols shot down prior to Australian Open
description: With the Australian Open right around the corner, top-ranked men’s player Novak Djokovic, who was also the former head of the ATP Player Council, reportedly put together a list of demands amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: More Australian Open tennis players in quarantine after airport coronavirus tests
description: The number of players in hard quarantine swelled to 72 ahead of the Australian Open after a fifth positive coronavirus test was returned from the charter flights bringing players, coaches, officials and media to Melbourne for the season-opening tennis major.

title: Players in lockdown after positive virus cases in Australia
description: Grand Slam champions are among the 47 players in hard lockdown after four positive tests for COVID-19 emerged from two of the charter flights bringing players, staff, officials and media to Australia for the first tennis major of the season.

title: Australian Open arrivals hit by 3 COVID-19 positive tests
description: Three coronavirus cases have been detected among charter flights carrying tennis players, coaches and officials to Melbourne ahead of the Australian Open, health authorities and tournament organizers said Saturday.

title: Players arrive for Australian Open; straight into quarantine
description: Two-time Australian Open champion Victoria Azarenka was among the earliest arrivals into Melbourne on one of the 15 charter flights bringing players and officials into the city for the first Grand Slam tennis tournament of the year.

title: Andy Murray tests positive for virus before Australian Open
description: Andy Murray has tested positive for the coronavirus days before he was due to leave Britain for the Australian Open, a person with knowledge of the situation told The Associated Press on Thursday.

title: Sandgren gets OK to fly to Australia despite COVID-19 result
description: Tennys Sandgren forced an early clarification of the COVID-19 rules as the first of 15 charter flights began flying Down Under to deliver players for the Australian Open.

title: Kenin beats Putintseva to reach Abu Dhabi quarterfinals
description: Australian Open champion Sofia Kenin of the United States came back from match point down to beat Yulia Putintseva and reach the quarterfinals of the Abu Dhabi Open on Saturday.

title: TENNIS '21: COVID questions key; Djokovic, Nadal eye records
description: When the 2020 men’s tennis season ended at the ATP Finals, Rafael Nadal captured a common sentiment that still holds true as the 2021 tennis season is set to begin this week.

title: The name game: A few athletes primed for breakouts in '21
description: For some, the sky's the limit, which also just happens to be the title of the book written by 12-year-old British skateboarder Sky Brown.

title: Agent to AP: Federer to miss Australia; planning 2021 return
description: Roger Federer is withdrawing from the Australian Open while he continues preparing to return to action after two operations on his right knee and a tour absence that will have lasted longer than a year, his agent told The Associated Press.

title: Activist, champion: Naomi Osaka is AP Female Athlete of Year
description: With tennis, like so much of the world, shut down because of the coronavirus pandemic, Naomi Osaka found herself with time to read and think.

title: How the coronavirus pandemic affected sports in 2020
description: The only thing 2020 will be remembered for is how the coronavirus affected everyone and everything.

title: ATP: Start of 2021 calendar includes delayed Australian Open
description: The Australian Open is set to begin Feb. 8, three weeks later than planned, as part of a pandemic-altered 2021 tennis calendar released by the men’s professional tour.

title: Roger Federer’s tennis future in doubt after shocking speech
description: Roger Federer’s speech at the Switzerland Sport Awards is sending shockwaves across the tennis world after an alarming admission that his body may deny him a return in 2021.

title: Wimbledon champ, Tennis Hall of Famer Alex Olmedo dead at 84
description: Alex Olmedo, who won the Wimbledon and Australian Championships singles titles in 1959 and was inducted into the International Tennis Hall of Fame in 1987, has died. He was 84.

title: Dennis Ralston, Hall of Fame tennis player, dies at 78
description: Dennis Ralston, a five-time Grand Slam doubles champion who was one of the initial players signed to the professional World Championship Tennis tour in the 1960s and a member of the sport's Hall of Fame, died Sunday. He was 78.

title: Boris Becker leaves role at German Tennis Federation
description: Tennis great Boris Becker said Wednesday he is stepping down from a position overseeing youth development and the Davis Cup team at the German Tennis Federation.

title: Simple as 1-2-3: Medvedev tops Thiem for ATP Finals title
description: Daniil Medvedev did not travel an easy path to the biggest title of his career at the ATP Finals: He beat No. 3 Dominic Thiem for the championship after earlier getting past No. 1 Novak Djokovic and No. 2 Rafael Nadal.

title: It'll be Thiem-Medvedev, not Djokovic-Nadal, at ATP Finals
description: Instead of No. 1 Novak Djokovic vs. No. 2 Rafael Nadal for the ATP Finals trophy, it’ll be No. 3 Dominic Thiem against No. 4 Daniil Medvedev.

title: 'Tight and nervous,' Thiem tops No. 1 Djokovic at ATP Finals
description: Dominic Thiem thought winning his first Grand Slam title at the U.S. Open would make him calmer in the tensest moments of the biggest matches.

title: Djokovic beats Zverev, advances to semifinals at ATP Finals
description: Novak Djokovic reached the semifinals at the ATP Finals and eliminated Alexander Zverev on Friday by beating the German 6-3, 7-6 (4), ensuring the top four players in the world advanced at the season-ending event for the first time since 2004.

title: Thiem beats Tsitsipas in 3 sets in ATP Finals opener
description: Dominic Thiem made sure this year's ATP Finals didn't begin the same way last year's ended.

title: Naomi Osaka schools boyfriend Cordae in cruel TikTok tennis video
description: Three-time grand slam champion Naomi Osaka’s boyfriend Cordae actually thought he could beat her in tennis.

title: Medvedev beats Zverev to win his 1st Paris Masters final
description: Daniil Medvedev won the Paris Masters for the first time by beating Alexander Zverev 5-7, 6-4, 6-1 Sunday for his eighth career title and third at a Masters event.

title: Zverev tops Nadal, sets up Paris Masters final vs. Medvedev
description: Alexander Zverev advanced to the Paris Masters final for the first time by beating top-seeded Rafael Nadal 6-4, 7-5 on Saturday, denying Nadal the chance to win a tournament that continues to elude him.

title: Sabalenka cruises past Azarenka for title at Ostrava Open
description: Third-seeded Aryna Sabalenka cruised to the title at the inaugural Ostrava Open on Sunday, defeating fourth-seeded Victoria Azarenka 6-2, 6-2 in the first WTA all-Belarusian final.

title: Tennis legend Boris Becker accused of failing to give up Wimbledon, Australian Open trophies to settle debts
description: Boris Becker was accused in a London court on Thursday of failing to give back two of his Wimbledon trophies, along with two Australian Open trophies, which were to be sold to settle his debts.

title: Zverev beats Auger-Aliassime in Cologne to end title wait
description: Alexander Zverev ended his 17-month wait for a title by drawing on the pain of his U.S. Open final defeat to beat Felix Auger-Aliassime 6-3, 6-3 and win the Cologne Indoors on Sunday.

title: US tennis pro Sam Querrey flees Russia after testing positive for coronavirus: 'Serious breach of protocol'
description: American tennis player Sam Querrey has reportedly fled Russia on a private jet after he and his family tested positive for COVID-19 earlier this week and is now believed to be staying at an unknown location somewhere in Europe.

title: Nadal beats Djokovic in straight sets at French open to win 20th Grand Slam
description: Rafael Nadal secured his title as king of the clay on Sunday after defeating Novak Djokovic in the Men’s final of the French Open to extend his record to 13th titles at Roland Garros and his 20th Grand Slam.

title: Poland's Iga Swiatek tops Sofia Kenin, wins French Open title
description: Iga Swiatek is in a class of her own.

title: Nadal closes in on 13th French Open, Federer-tying 20th Slam
description: After so much talk, by Rafael Nadal and others, about so many reasons why this pandemic-postponed French Open could be more difficult for him — cooler autumn weather; slightly heavier tennis balls; lack of match preparation — the King of Clay is right back where he usually is: in the final.

title: Kenin, 21, will face unseeded Swiatek, 19, in French final
description: Sofia Kenin entered 2020 with an 11-11 record in Grand Slam action. Never had made the quarterfinals at any clay-court tournament until this trip to Roland Garros — and lost her only tuneup match on the surface 6-0, 6-0 last month.

title: WTA players reveal why they returned to the courts amid coronavirus uncertainty
description: The 2020 tennis season, like every other sport, was marred by the coronavirus pandemic and, while players had the option to stay away from the courts some returned to finish the final two majors of the season.

title: Djokovic's body acts up at French Open; faces Tsitsipas next
description: The first obvious sign of trouble for Novak Djokovic came when he stepped out into Court Philippe Chatrier with a rather large square of beige athletic tape on the back of his neck.

title: Why Danielle Collins had boyfriend switch seats during tense French Open match
description: Danielle Collins had a strange moment during her quarterfinal match at the French Open.

title: Petra Kvitova serves up storm to reach 1st SF since 2012
description: The rain finally held off at the French Open, so Petra Kvitova rained down aces instead.

title: Investigation opened into match-fixing at French Open match
description: The Paris prosecutor’s office has opened a police investigation into suspicions of match-fixing at the French Open.

title: Novak Djokovic hits line judge with ball — again — in French Open, advances to quarterfinals
description: It’s a mistake he probably was hoping to avoid making again.

title: Emotions flood back for Kvitova as she reaches quarterfinals
description: Petra Kvitova stood wide-eyed and perfectly still, scarcely believing she was through to her first French Open quarterfinal in eight years after winning 6-2, 6-4 against Zhang Shuai of China on Monday.

title: Petra Kvitova reaches first French Open quarterfinal since 2012
description: Two-time Wimbledon champion Petra Kvitova reached the French Open quarterfinals for the first time in eight years by beating Zhang Shuai 6-2, 6-4.

title: Years after anorexia, hiatus, Italian reaches French Open QF
description: Martina Trevisan has been doing video chats from her hotel room with her mental coach every day along the way to the quarterfinals at Roland Garros, a run the 159th-ranked qualifier acknowledges is “a little” shocking, just not as much to her as to everyone else.

title: Winds of change blow on day of upsets at French Open
description: On a Sunday of upsets among the women at the French Open, revenge was a dish served up in an autumnal chill by a Polish teenager.

title: Djokovic leads been-there-done-that crew at wild French Open
description: Surprising results and “Who is that?” stories abound as this one-of-these-is-not-like-the-others French Open heads to the fourth round — with the wild-card entry, the pair of qualifiers and the group of men and women who keep advancing in their tournament debuts.

title: Paris the hard way: Qualifiers making mark at French Open
description: As the stars of tennis converged on the French Open and settled with entourages into bio-secured hotels, Daniel Altmaier was already grafting on the clay courts, getting dirty in the dust and picking up clues here, tips there about the surface's quirks as he fought like a man in a hurry through qualifying to reach the main draw.

title: Early-bird Thiem, Halep advance to 4th round at French Open
description: Waking up early Friday for his third-round match at the French Open, Dominic Thiem was surprised to see the morning skies were still dark.

title: 2020 French Open: What to know about women's singles tournament

title: 2020 French Open: What to know about men's singles tournament

title: Rafael Nadal ready to forgo 2020 tennis season, look ahead to 2021 amid coronavirus pandemic

title: Murray's cursing, muttering highlight virus video tennis
description: A little glimpse of what a mic’d-up Andy Murray might sound like on a real-life court — cursing, muttering, grunting — provided the highlights for the coronavirus pandemic’s first video game tennis tournament involving pros.

title: Nadal does't see tennis back soon, is worried about injuries
description: Rafael Nadal says it will be “very difficult” for tennis to return to action any time soon and is concerned about the risk of injuries when the sport resumes.

title: Virus-caused unemployment in tennis could lead some to quit
description: Like plenty of people from all walks of life, 26-year-old Mitchell Krueger wants to sign up for unemployment benefits to make up for income lost because of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Novak Djokovic against mandatory vaccine to combat coronavirus pandemic
description: Tennis superstar Novak Djokovic expressed skepticism Sunday over the possibility of mandatory vaccinations to combat the coronavirus pandemic.

title: US Open tennis COVID-19 decision by June; no fans 'unlikely'
description: A decision on whether to postpone or cancel the U.S. Open because of the coronavirus pandemic is expected by June, the U.S. Tennis Association’s new CEO said Thursday, calling the prospect of holding the Grand Slam tournament without spectators “highly unlikely.”

title: Coco Gauff reveals struggle with rise to stardom, 'added hype that I didn't want'
description: The hype and hoopla surrounding a teen’s rise to the top of a particular sport can have an adverse effect on young players and Coco Guaff became a prime example of that last year.

title: Tennis tours coordinating possible post-virus rescheduling
description: The men’s and women’s professional tennis tours are examining contingency plans for post-coronavirus rescheduling, including the possibility of pushing back the end of the 2020 season.

title: Wimbledon canceled amid coronavirus outbreak
description: Wimbledon, one of tennis' most prestigious major tournaments, became the latest sporting event to be canceled amid the coronavirus epidemic on Wednesday.

title: ESPN’s Patrick McEnroe tests positive for coronavirus
description: Patrick McEnroe is the latest sports figure to reveal he has tested positive for coronavirus.

title: US Open tennis site to be turned into temporary hospital amid coronavirus outbreak
description: Part of the Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Queens will turn into a 350-bed temporary hospital beginning Tuesday.

title: Roger Federer stays busy during coronavirus pandemic with tennis trick shots
description: The coronavirus pandemic has even legendary tennis player Roger Federer going a bit stir crazy.

title: Wimbledon faces possibility of postponement or cancellation over coronavirus outbreak
description: Wimbledon has the chance to be postponed or canceled entirely as All England Club officials called for an “emergency meeting” to discuss options as sporting events shut down over the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Tennis tours stop until June for COVID-19; rankings frozen
description: The ATP and WTA professional tennis tours suspended all competition through at least June 7 because of the new coronavirus pandemic and froze their rankings Wednesday "until further notice."

title: French Open postponed until September because of COVID-19

title: Opelka doubles up, tops Nishioka to win Delray Beach Open

title: Rafael Nadal wins 5th Roger Cup title, beating Medvedev
