title: DH slugger Nelson Cruz, Nationals reach 1-yr deal
description: Free agent designated hitter Nelson Cruz and the Washington Nationals have agreed to a one-year, $15 million deal, a person familiar with the contract told The Associated Press on Sunday night.

title: Sports to deliver at a time they're needed the most
description: Once again, hope springs eternal, at least on the ballfields in Arizona and Florida. Soon, there will be spring training games and then a season that even the collective greed of Major League Baseball owners and players couldn’t derail.

title: Champion Braves open camp with Acuña, Morton but no Freeman
description: Braves manager Brian Snitker held court in front of a “2021 World Champions” banner, peaking occasionally at the nearby bullpen, where World Series hero Charlie Morton threw a side session. Around the corner, Ronald Acuña Jr. and Cristian Pache pulled up in matching, glitzy-gold SUVs and posed for a photo.

title: Astros' Justin Verlander 'on cloud nine' after 1st bullpen session
description: Watching Houston’s run through the 2021 playoffs, Justin Verlander considered lending a hand – an arm, actually – to the cause.

title: Star slugger Miguel Cabrera, Tigers start spring with a new outlook
description: Miguel Cabrera showed up Sunday morning for the start of his 20th spring training camp in the majors, his 15th with the Detroit Tigers.

title: Yanks' Aaron Boone concerned about impact of Canadian COVID rules
description: New York Yankees manager Aaron Boone is concerned about the roster impact stemming from rules that Major League Baseball players who aren't vaccinated against the coronavirus won’t be allowed to travel into Canada to face the Blue Jays in Toronto.

title: Phillies manager Joe Girardi understands he has to win
description: Joe Girardi isn’t concerned about managing the Philadelphia Phillies without a contract extension.

title: Nationals' Stephen Strasburg opens spring in prep mode, not rehab
description: Stephen Strasburg played catch when the Washington Nationals held their first official workout of spring training on Sunday, and the 2019 World Series MVP sat down for a chat with manager Dave Martinez and pitching coach Jim Hickey to discuss where things stand as he comes back from two consecutive seasons lost to injury and surgery.

title: Former MLB pitcher dead at 44 after falling off ladder at his home
description: Former MLB pitcher Odalis Pérez died Thursday night after he fell off a ladder in his home.

title: Twins get pitching vet Gray from Reds for 1st-rounder Petty
description: The Minnesota Twins took their first significant step toward restocking their starting pitching, acquiring right-hander Sonny Gray in a trade on Sunday with the Cincinnati Reds.

title: Mets' Max Scherzer celebrated after MLB lockout ended: 'I drank a lot'
description: Mets starting pitcher Max Scherzer arrived at the team’s training complex Friday before throwing a bullpen session as he prepares to make his New York debut next month.

title: Rockies agree to deals with José Iglesias, Alex Colomé
description: The Colorado Rockies have agreed to one-year contracts with shortstop José Iglesias and right-handed reliever Alex Colomé, a person familiar with the deals told The Associated Press on Sunday.

title: CC Sabathia says Derek Jeter was ‘pissed’ at Marlins for not spending money
description: When Derek Jeter stepped down as Marlins CEO and sold his 4% ownership stake on Feb. 28, it came as a shock to those around the league.

title: MLB extends Trevor Bauer's absence from Dodgers after lockout
description: As the MLB lockout was lifted Thursday and players beginning to report to spring training this weekend, Los Angeles Dodgers pitcher Trevor Bauer won’t be among them.

title: Yankees' Miguel Andújar robbed at gunpoint in Dominican Republic: reports
description: New York Yankees infielder Miguel Andújar was reportedly robbed at gunpoint in the Dominican Republic Wednesday.

title: MLB spring training: Shane Bieber shows in Guardians gear, Vlad Guerrero Jr set
description: Arizona Diamondbacks catcher Carson Kelly and manager Torey Lovullo shared a hug, a grin and a few slaps on the back under the bright blue sky that the Cactus League is known for providing.

title: Unvaccinated MLB players can't travel to Canada to play Blue Jays
description: Major League Baseball players who are not vaccinated against the coronavirus won't be allowed to travel into Canada to face the Blue Jays in Canada and won't be paid for those games.

title: Odalis Perez, former All-Star MLB pitcher, dead at 44
description: Odalis Perez, a former MLB pitcher who spent 11 seasons in the big leagues, died after an accident at his home in the Dominican Republic, his attorney said Thursday. He was 44.

title: MLB, players agree to new labor deal after months of negotiating
description: Major League Baseball and the MLB Players Association agreed to a new labor deal on Thursday, according to multiple reports.

title: MLB commissioner Rob Manfred cancels 93 more games amid lockout
description: MLB commissioner Rob Manfred canceled 93 more baseball games on Wednesday.

title: Union narrows gap with MLB but issues remain blocking deal
description: Negotiators for locked-out players took steps toward Major League Baseball in a counteroffer Wednesday that still left a gap between the bickering sides after Commissioner Rob Manfred let pass his deadline to preserve a 162-game season.

title: MLB, union bargain for 16 1/2 hours, recess until morning
description: Negotiators for locked-out players and Major League Baseball spent 16 1/2 hours bargaining, then recessed talks until Wednesday morning as Commissioner Rob Manfred let his deadline to reach a deal preserving a 162-game season pass.

title: MLB, union meet ahead of deadline to salvage 162-game season
description: Negotiators for locked out players and Major League Baseball held a morning bargaining session ahead of Commissioner Rob Manfred's Tuesday deadline for a deal that would preserve a 162-game season.

title: MLB lockout: Yankees president expresses fear of season being lost, losing baseball fans
description: New York Yankees team president Randy Levine expressed how dire the situation is between the MLB owners and the players union as the possibility of more canceled games hangs in the balance.

title: Despite vitriol, MLB owners, locked-out players closing gap
description: For all the vitriol, Major League Baseball owners and locked-out players have closed the gap in recent weeks and are negotiating on similar frameworks for a new collective bargaining agreement.

title: Why banning the shift is the best thing baseball could've done
description: Now that baseball is planning on banning the shift for what’s left of the 2022 season, articles bashing the move are all over the web. I’ve personally defended the shift remaining in baseball, but now that I’ve taken some time to think this out, it’s clear the shift has no business in this game.

title: Labor relations experts following MLB negotiations from afar
description: Allen Sanderson grew up in Idaho. He played high school baseball and worked for a minor league team in Twin Falls, providing a ride home for Dick Allen long before he became a feared slugger with the Philadelphia Phillies.

title: MLB, locked-out players meet again, no sign of breakthrough
description: Major League Baseball and locked-out players talked for 95 minutes on the 95th day of the lockout, largely restating their positions and showing no sign of a breakthrough that could get their derailed season back on track.

title: MLB, players resume talks, 5 days after openers canceled
description: Major League Baseball and its locked-out players resumed negotiations on Sunday, five days after Commissioner Rob Manfred canceled opening day on March 31.

title: Spring training's postponement impacts small businesses, ballpark employees
description: If it weren’t for the ongoing MLB lockout, spring training games would already be underway for the league’s 30 teams.

title: MLB lockout: Players start $1M fund for workers impacted
description: Locked-out Major League Baseball players are starting a $1 million fund to support workers impacted by canceled games.

title: Minor league baseball, hockey teams seeking COVID-19 relief
description: Laying off 17 people in the Charlotte Checkers front office of 25 felt like gutting a team for chief operating officer Tera Black.

title: MLB, union meet for 1 1/2 hours, discuss next step in talks
description: Deputy Commissioner Dan Halem and chief union negotiator Bruce Meyer met for 1 1/2 hours Thursday and discussed the major issues in the stalled talks to reach a deal that would end Major League Baseball's lockout.

title: Tom Glavine predicts what MLB lockout will do to the game: 'Fans are being impacted'
description: Baseball Hall of Famer Tom Glavine talked about what the lockout will do to the game in the grand scheme, and to the former Atlanta Braves and New York Mets pitcher, it’s not good.

title: Angels' Mike Trout speaks out on MLB lockout: 'We need to get this CBA right'
description: Los Angeles Angels superstar Mike Trout, who is arguably the best player in all of baseball, voiced his thoughts on the MLB canceling Opening Day following nine straight days of negotiations between the league and the players’ association.

title: MLB star Anthony Rizzo reveals what he'll miss most while season is on hold
description: Anthony Rizzo, a veteran All-Star first baseman who is currently a free agent, expressed disappointment for the fans after MLB owners and the players union failed to come to an agreement to end the lockout.

title: Cubs' Marcus Stroman, others rip Rob Manfred amid MLB lockout: 'Too many dinosaurs controlling the game'
description: After MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred announced that baseball canceled Opening Day, players across the league made it a priority to share their thoughts on social media regarding the lockout.

title: MLB Commissioner Rob Manfred cancels Opening Day, both sides fail to reach agreement at deadline
description: Major League Baseball Commissioner Rob Manfred announced that baseball is canceling Opening Day after the players rejected the league's "best and final offer" on Tuesday following nine straight days of negotiations.

title: MLB to make 'best offer' before lockout deadline passes
description: Major League Baseball threatened to let its 5 p.m. Tuesday deadline for a labor deal pass and start canceling regular season games, saying it would make a final offer to locked out players as the clock ticked away.

title: Noah Syndergaard has some fun with MLB insider's column ripping league owners
description: Recently acquired Los Angeles Angels pitcher Noah Syndergaard still has a sense of humor, despite the MLB lockout that has already threatened Opening Day and perhaps the entire first month of the season.

title: Derek Jeter's resignation as Marlins' CEO sparks theory from Dodgers star Justin Turner
description: Derek Jeter’s decision to step down as CEO of the Miami Marlins prompted a theory from World Series champion Justin Turner on Monday.

title: Yankees' Joey Gallo pokes fun at himself with LinkedIn profile while CBA negotiations heat up
description: New York Yankees outfielder Joey Gallo jumped on LinkedIn – just in case.

title: MLB lockout: Yankees pitcher rips owners as deadline to hammer out deal gets pushed back
description: New York Yankees pitcher Jameson Taillon ripped baseball owners as the deadline to save the start of the MLB season was extended to 5 p.m. ET on Tuesday.

title: Baseball owners, players extend talks until 5 p.m. Tuesday after intense negotiations
description: Major League Baseball has extended its deadline for reaching a labor deal to 5 p.m. on Tuesday in attempts to salvage opening day on March 31.

title: Bryce Harper trolls hard with an epic Instagram post
description: MLB owners and the MLBPA are meeting for the last time today, and if there’s no deal in place by the day’s end, games are expected to be canceled.

title: MLB labor talks intensify as deadline nears to save openers
description: Locked-out players and Major League Baseball engaged in a series of intense meetings Monday in an effort to forge the path to a labor deal before management’s deadline for salvaging opening day on March 31.

title: MLB: Manfred, union meet on deadline day to save openers
description: Commissioner Rob Manfred and top deputy Dan Halem met with players Monday on the final day of negotiations to end the lockout before Major League Baseball's deadline to salvage a March 31 start to the regular season and a 162-game schedule.

title: Derek Jeter leaves post as Miami Marlins' CEO, shareholder
description: Derek Jeter went into the offseason talking about the Miami Marlins spending more money on contracts, figuring out ways to contend and continuing to build for the future.

title: MLB: It's deadline day to save opening day, 162-game season
description: Max Scherzer and Andrew Miller were leading the players' bargaining team Monday for the final day of negotiations to end the lockout before Major League Baseball's deadline to salvage a March 31 start to the regular season and a 162-game schedule.

title: MLB players, teams talk for 7th day in row, deadline nears
description: Locked-out players and management officials were bargaining for the seventh straight day Sunday, just one day before Major League Baseball's deadline to salvage March 31 openers and a 162-game schedule.

title: Red Sox release minor-leaguer following racist, homophobic social media posts: 'I am a racist'
description: The Boston Red Sox released minor league player Brett Netzer after the 2017 third-round pick sent out a series of racist, homophobic and antisemitic tweets, according to The Athletic.

title: MLB cancels all spring training games through March 7
description: Baseball players and owners took a first step toward salvaging opening day, nearing agreement Friday on an amateur draft lottery during lockout negotiations that included a surprise one-on-one meeting between Commissioner Rob Manfred and union head Tony Clark.

title: MLB 4 days from deadline to cancel games and shorten season
description: Another negotiating session produced only minor movement and no proposals on big-money issues, leaving Major League Baseball four days from management's Monday night deadline for a deal to salvage opening day and a 162-game season.

title: Labor talks resume with MLB deadline looming
description: With less than 4 1/2 days until Major League Baseball's deadline for a labor deal to salvage opening day and a 162-game season, New York Yankees owner Hal Steinbrenner, Houston pitcher Lance McCullers Jr. and Miami infielder Miguel Rojas joined negotiations Thursday.

title: Paul O'Neill honored 21 to join Ruth's 3, Gehrig's 4, Yogi's 8
description: Traded to New York by Cincinnati in November 1992, Paul O'Neill walked out to Monument Park at old Yankee Stadium.

title: Hall of Famer Goose Gossage slams MLB commissioner Rob Manfred, Yankees GM Brian Cashman in epic rant
description: Hall of Fame pitcher Goose Gossage isn’t afraid to hold back.

title: Rachel Balkovec says support from players, staff has been great
description: Rachel Balkovec is teaching at the New York Yankees minor league minicamp and is a student, too.

title: MLB: Season will be shortened if no deal by end of Monday
description: Major League Baseball said Wednesday that the 2022 season will be shortened if no labor agreement has been reached by the end of Monday.

title: Rangers top prospect Josh Jung has surgery to repair torn labrum
description: Texas Rangers top prospect Josh Jung had surgery Wednesday to repair a torn labrum in his left shoulder, ending the third baseman's chance of being an option for the big league roster this spring.

title: Cubs' Marcus Stroman rips Mets, says he's 'beyond thankful' he's no longer on team
description: Starting pitcher Marcus Stroman has made it clear he's excited about his fresh start with the Chicago Cubs after joining the organization earlier this offseason.
